result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin T. VANCE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders expungement under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence.
To be completed through Manitowoc County by 12-01-15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin T. VANCE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Public Works Department indicating defendant has not complied with community service order as of 12-07-15.

Community Service Order.
Copy emailed to Doreen Bessert.

GUILTY plea entered to the charge of theft.  Convicted.
The Court imposes a $100.00 fine plus costs, total of $379.00, to be paid by 11-01-15 or 7 days
The defendant is ordered to complete fifty (50) hours of community service through Manitowoc County by 12-01-15.
Expungement is ordered under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence.  The Court finds that the defendant will benefit and society will not be harmed by expungment in this matter.
Minutes.

The defendant needs to obtain proof of restitution being paid.
Plea date is reset to 09-01-15 at 9:30 a.m.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 08-19-15 at 2:30 p.m.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 05-26-15 at 9:20 a.m.  Plea date is set for 08-19-15 at 2:30 p.m.  
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 04-27-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with Family Pantry.  Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

RE:  Family Pantry, on 02-20-15.
Initial appearance is set for 04-20-15 at 1:30 p.m.
